parsed.internal_thinking:
My first settlement at Node 42 is a powerhouse for an Ore/Wheat strategy, sitting on two Wheat 9s and an Ore 5 (12 total pips). However, I am currently completely lacking Wood and Brick. I have three options for my starting road: Node 41, Node 43, or Node 50.

1. Direction 43: Leads to Node 43 (13 pips: Wh9, Wh6, Wh9). While the pips are high, it's extreme over-specialization in Wheat. 
2. Direction 50: Leads to a 3:1 port. Useful later, but doesn't help with immediate resource scarcity.
3. Direction 41: Leads to Node 41 (11 pips: O5, Wh9, B10). This is the best strategic choice because it introduces Brick (B10) into my production. Furthermore, continuing from Node 41 leads to Node 40, which features the Wood 2:1 port—a perfect synergy for a player likely to have excess Wheat/Ore but no Wood.

I will place the road toward Node 41 to prioritize getting Brick and opening a path to the Wood port. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Settled Node 42 (Wh9, O5, Wh9). Road placed toward Node 41 to secure Brick 10 and the Wood port at Node 40. Second settlement priority: Wood and Sheep. Target Node 11 (B6, S5, W12) or Node 31 (Wh9, B10, W11) if available on the return pick.
parsed.say_outloud: Going to head towards the coast for now. That Ore and Wheat is a nice start, but I'll definitely need some more variety soon!
